title: Review & setlist: Neko Case stuns with casual vocal brilliance at The Wilbur
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Concert Reviews Overheard among the crowd leaving the Neko Case concert Thursday night: “She’s got some pipes!
” Neko Case at MASS MoCA in 2022.
She brought her band to The Wilbur Thursday in support of her new album, "Neon Grey Midnight Green.

title: Reported shooting in Cambridge prompts brief shelter-in-place order at Harvard
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Local News There aren't any known victims or concerns about public safety risk at this time, a spokesman for Cambridge police said.
Harvard University briefly implemented a shelter-in-place order Friday morning while police searched for a suspect on a bicycle who allegedly shot at another person in Cambridge.
“Cambridge Police are currently on-scene of a shots fired incident that took place on Sherman Street in the vicinity of Danehy Park,” a spokesman for Cambridge police told Boston.

title: Jewish groups seek answers after Rhode Island high school football players in antisemitic hazing case reinstated
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News The superintendent reversed season-long suspensions for five players accused of taking part in what the advocacy groups called “a horrific antisemitic hazing attack.

” Two Jewish advocacy groups are demanding answers after Smithfield, Rhode Island, school officials reinstated several football players accused of taking part in what they called a “horrific antisemitic hazing attack.

”In a joint statement Thursday, the Jewish Alliance for Greater Rhode Island and the Sandra Bornstein Holocaust Education Center condemned the district’s decision to let the players return, calling it a betrayal of the community’s trust and a setback in the fight against antisemitism.

title: Mike Vrabel is not falling into the trap of comparing Drake Maye to Tom Brady
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Morning Sports Update "He's got a lot of years to go.
" Drake Maye and Mike Vrabel have helped the Patriots get out to a 5-2 start this season.

title: The second best spirits tasting room in America is in New England, according to USA Today readers

title: Boston’s Patricia Cornwell talks hybrid monkeys, AI, and Nicole Kidman ahead of Boston Book Fest
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Books Cornwell’s new thriller is on shelves now — and “Scarpetta” will soon stream starring Kidman, Jamie Lee Curtis and Bobby Cannavale.

She never yawns or says a commonplace thing.

title: 9 games in, an ‘embarrassed’ Bruins team is already seeing their season splinter
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins "The reality — I think we saw last year — is what happens when you don't perform.
And that's the way things seem to be going.
” The Bruins have lost six games in a row.

title: Ask the gardener: Why to ‘Leave the Leaves’ in your yard this fall
author: Ulrich Lorimer
bullets: Gardening A campaign by the National Wildlife Federation and the Xerces Society, asserts that leaves are not trash, debris, or yard waste.
Fallen leaves MATTHIEU DELATY/Hans Lucas/AFP via Getty Images ShareSend this article to your social connections.
Autumn in New England is a cherished time marked by well-honored traditions, including apple picking, pumpkins, hayrides, and leaf peeping.
